Currently, diverse measurement and evaluation approaches are required in the context of the implementation and operating of service oriented architectures (short SOA). Corresponding approaches considers information management activities, development related aspects and the necessary service management during the real operation. Typical SOA metrics can be found for the evaluation of business-, process-, finance-, quality-or governance-related aspects. This paper concentrates on guidelines for the selection of
['bib']title: Guidelines for the Service-Development within Service-oriented Architectures

['bib']abstract: We present a systematic literature review performed to understand and summarize the application of COSMIC which is a functional size measurement (FSM) method, mainly applied for estimating software development effort. The results reveals that it is considered to be suitable for a broader range of application domains, eg, Web applications, Mobile app. Furthermore, the review shows that a lot has been done also for automating the use of COSMIC as well as for rapidly and early applying the method through some approximations.
['bib']author: Martino, Vincenzo Luigi and Gravino, Carmine
['bib']booktitle: 2022 48th Euromicro Conference on Software Engineering and Advanced Applications (SEAA)
['bib']title: Using COSMIC to measure functional size of software: a Systematic Literature Review
